companies.current_policy: Full-time office return mandated effective June 1, 2025. AEP is ending its hybrid work model and requiring all employees to return to a five-day, in-office work schedule.

policy_details.office_requirements: All employees required in office 5 days per week starting June 1, 2025. Exceptions only for employees hired specifically for remote roles or those who don't live near an AEP facility.
policy_details.flexibility: Minimal - only remote-specific hires and geographically distant employees exempt

companies.key_findings: AEP announced in January 2025 that approximately 5,000 workers (including 2,400 in central Ohio and 300 in Indiana) must return to full-time office work by June 1, 2025. This represents a complete elimination of their previous hybrid work model. Company cites $54 billion investment plan over next five years and belief that 'face-to-face, in-person interactions have real benefits.' Employees report frustration with leadership and increased attrition.

companies.current_policy: Hybrid model requiring corporate employees to work in office 3 days per week with 2 days remote flexibility.

policy_details.office_requirements: Corporate staff required in office 3 days per week. Store employees work full-time in retail locations.
policy_details.flexibility: Moderate - 2 days remote per week for corporate roles

companies.key_findings: Ulta Beauty maintains a hybrid work policy for corporate employees requiring 3 days in office per week. Earlier reports from 2022 mentioned a 'FlexWork @ Ulta Beauty' program with 2-3 days office presence plus 4 weeks per year of fully remote work from any location. Current policy appears to have standardized at 3 days. Store employees remain full-time in retail locations. Policy has been stable throughout 2024 with no major changes announced.

companies.current_policy: Hybrid model with inconsistent enforcement. Officially 3 days per week for technology employees and 4 days for other departments, though implementation varies by manager.

policy_details.office_requirements: 3 days per week for tech employees, 4 days for other departments. CTO stated won't take attendance, but CEO and HR indicate it's mandatory. Manager discretion appears significant.
policy_details.flexibility: Limited and inconsistent - policy enforcement varies significantly

companies.key_findings: Wayfair is actively tightening its RTO approach. In January 2024, the company laid off 1,650 employees (13% of workforce), with remote workers disproportionately affected. CEO Niraj Shah indicated the company 'has figured out which ones make sense in-person' and executives believe 'most workers should be at their desks in an office on most days.' Official policy is 3 days for tech, 4 days for others, but messaging is inconsistent - CTO says it's up to managers while CEO/HR say mandatory. Clear trend away from remote work despite maintaining some remote roles strategically.

companies.current_policy: No publicly announced formal RTO policy. Healthcare organization with mix of clinical (on-site) and corporate roles. Some remote positions available but no standardized hybrid schedule disclosed.

policy_details.office_requirements: Clinical staff work on-site at medical facilities. Corporate/administrative roles have some remote options but no standard policy publicly disclosed. Role-dependent rather than company-wide mandate.
policy_details.flexibility: Varies significantly by position and department

companies.key_findings: Novant Health has not publicly announced a formal RTO policy or standardized hybrid work schedule. As a healthcare organization with 40+ medical facilities across NC, SC, and VA, most clinical staff work on-site. Corporate positions show some remote opportunities on job boards (FlexJobs, Indeed, ZipRecruiter), but no company-wide policy is publicly documented. Benefits guides and handbooks reviewed did not contain RTO policy details. Likely uses role-based approach rather than blanket policy. No evidence of recent policy changes or mandates in 2024-2025.
